parts.text: {"ticker":"AAPL","metrics":{"revenue":383000000000,"revenue_growth":0.03,"profit_margin":0.25,"cash_flow":107000000000,"market_cap":2800000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Apple maintains resilient fundamentals with stable revenue trends and modest low-single-digit growth. Its roughly 25% net margin underscores strong pricing power, efficient supply-chain execution, and a premium hardware-services mix. Cash-flow generation exceeding $100B provides substantial flexibility for R&D, capital returns, and ecosystem expansion. Growth in services remains a key driver of margin durability. Analysts expect gradual long-term expansion despite near-term hardware cyclicality. Key risks include regulatory scrutiny, competitive pressure in devices, and macro sensitivity in discretionary spending."}
{"ticker":"MSFT","metrics":{"revenue":220000000000,"revenue_growth":0.10,"profit_margin":0.33,"cash_flow":81000000000,"market_cap":3000000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Microsoft benefits from durable double-digit revenue growth supported by cloud adoption, enterprise software strength, and accelerating AI workloads. Net margins in the low-30% range reflect highly scalable economics across software and cloud services. Strong operating cash flow above $80B supports sustained investment in data centers, AI infrastructure, and acquisitions. Azure remains a key long-term growth engine with continued market-share gains. Analysts view Microsoft as a core secular compounder with strong visibility. Key risks include cloud-spending moderation, elevated infrastructure costs, and competitive pressure in AI platforms."}
{"ticker":"AMZN","metrics":{"revenue":570000000000,"revenue_growth":0.12,"profit_margin":0.06,"cash_flow":36000000000,"market_cap":1800000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Amazon’s fundamentals are improving with low-double-digit revenue growth driven by AWS, advertising, and operational efficiency in retail. Margins remain structurally lower than software peers but are recovering as logistics productivity improves. AWS is the company’s primary profit engine, and analysts see continued long-term demand for cloud and AI workloads. Cash flow near $36B supports ongoing capacity expansion in fulfillment and data centers. Analysts expect multi-year margin expansion as mix shifts toward higher-margin segments. Key risks include macro volatility, regulatory challenges, and intensifying competition in cloud services."}
{"ticker":"GOOGL","metrics":{"revenue":300000000000,"revenue_growth":0.09,"profit_margin":0.22,"cash_flow":91000000000,"market_cap":2000000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Alphabet continues to deliver steady high-single-digit growth supported by search resilience, YouTube monetization, and expanding cloud traction. Profitability remains strong with net margins in the low-20% range despite elevated investment in AI infrastructure. Free-cash-flow generation above $90B highlights capital-allocation strength. Google Cloud is increasingly contributing to margin expansion and competitive positioning. Analysts see long-term upside from AI integration across products. Key risks include regulatory exposure, competitive intensity in digital advertising, and monetization uncertainty around emerging AI models."}
{"ticker":"META","metrics":{"revenue":135000000000,"revenue_growth":0.15,"profit_margin":0.28,"cash_flow":49000000000,"market_cap":900000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Meta maintains strong mid-teens revenue growth supported by improving ad demand, better measurement tools, and strong engagement trends across its platforms. Margins have expanded meaningfully as management prioritizes operational efficiency. Cash-flow strength above $45B supports substantial investment in AI, infrastructure, and long-duration bets like AR/VR. Analysts view Meta’s competitive positioning as robust due to scale and data advantages. Risks center on regulatory scrutiny, competitive advertising channels, and uncertain long-term returns from Reality Labs."}
{"ticker":"TSLA","metrics":{"revenue":96000000000,"revenue_growth":0.19,"profit_margin":0.11,"cash_flow":9000000000,"market_cap":750000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Tesla’s fundamentals remain tied to its ability to scale manufacturing, improve cost efficiency, and expand global EV penetration. Revenue growth in the high-teens reflects expanding production capacity and strong delivery volumes. Margins have compressed due to pricing actions but remain supported by operational leverage and software-related opportunities. Cash flow near $9B helps fund capacity expansion and autonomous-driving initiatives. Analysts are divided on the pace of margin recovery and the monetization timeline for FSD. Key risks include competitive EV pricing, supply-chain constraints, and macro sensitivity in auto demand."}
{"ticker":"BRK.B","metrics":{"revenue":370000000000,"revenue_growth":0.05,"profit_margin":0.13,"cash_flow":65000000000,"market_cap":850000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Berkshire Hathaway continues to demonstrate stable financial performance driven by diversified operations across insurance, energy, industrials, and consumer businesses. Insurance underwriting profitability and investment income remain key earnings contributors. Cash-flow strength supports opportunistic capital deployment and share repurchases. The company’s decentralized operating model and conservative balance sheet underpin strong credit quality. Analysts view Berkshire as a long-duration compounder with defensive characteristics. Key risks include equity-market sensitivity, insurance-loss volatility, and limited near-term catalysts."}
{"ticker":"LLY","metrics":{"revenue":34000000000,"revenue_growth":0.18,"profit_margin":0.26,"cash_flow":8500000000,"market_cap":680000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Eli Lilly benefits from strong double-digit revenue growth driven by diabetes, obesity, and oncology portfolios. Margins remain robust as high-value innovative therapies scale globally. Pipeline execution continues to be a core driver of long-term upside. Cash flow supports continued R&D investment and capacity expansion. Analysts maintain a positive outlook due to strong demand visibility and competitive advantages in metabolic diseases. Key risks include regulatory delays, pricing pressure, and competitive pipeline developments."}
{"ticker":"AVGO","metrics":{"revenue":35000000000,"revenue_growth":0.09,"profit_margin":0.40,"cash_flow":17000000000,"market_cap":450000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Broadcom maintains strong fundamentals supported by enterprise networking, storage, and custom silicon demand. Profitability remains exceptional with net margins around 40%. Cash-flow generation near $17B enables disciplined capital allocation including dividends and strategic acquisitions. Analysts expect continued benefit from cloud and AI networking cycles. Risks include supplier concentration, integration challenges, and semiconductor cyclicality."}
{"ticker":"JPM","metrics":{"revenue":160000000000,"revenue_growth":0.08,"profit_margin":0.28,"cash_flow":30000000000,"market_cap":550000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"JPMorgan continues to deliver resilient revenue performance driven by lending strength, investment-banking normalization, and stable deposit trends. Margins in the high-20% range reflect disciplined risk management and scale advantages. Strong cash generation supports ongoing technology investment and capital distribution. Analysts view JPM as the highest-quality U.S. large-cap bank. Risks include credit-cycle deterioration, regulatory changes, and macro uncertainty affecting loan demand."}
{"ticker":"V","metrics":{"revenue":32000000000,"revenue_growth":0.11,"profit_margin":0.52,"cash_flow":16000000000,"market_cap":500000000000}}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Visa’s fundamentals remain strong with low-double-digit revenue growth supported by resilient global payment volumes. Net margins above 50% highlight highly scalable network economics. Cash flow exceeding $15B supports consistent buybacks and strategic investment. Analysts view Visa as a long-term beneficiary of the global shift toward digital payments. Key risks include regulatory actions, cross-border volatility, and competitive fintech innovation."}

{"fundamental_analysis":"Walmart maintains steady revenue growth supported by strong grocery, omnichannel adoption, and membership engagement. Analysts view Walmart as a defensive large-cap with consistent market-share gains. Key risks include pricing pressure, wage inflation, and macro-driven shifts in consumer spending patterns."}

Key risks include regulatory frameworks, currency volatility, and competitive pressure in digital payments."}
